result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alexis D Acosta

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Alexis D Acosta appeared by video.  Attorney Jason Daniel Baltz appeared by video for Alexis D Acosta.  Attorney Mallory R Davis in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Status conference held. Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. State placed final offer on the record. Defendant rejected offer. State withdrew their offer to the defendant.  Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed 48 hours before the final pretrial date. Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 29.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

OFF THE RECORD- Defendant Alexis D Acosta in court with attorney Jason Daniel Baltz.  Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defense counsel requests a Status Conference date. Case adjourned to Br 29.  Status conference scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Alexis D Acosta in court with attorney Jason Daniel Baltz.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Scheduling conference held. Defense counsel has discovery and an offer from the State and requests an additional scheduling conference.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Alexis D Acosta in court with attorney Jason Daniel Baltz and Zak Wroblewski.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Defense acknowledges receipt of the Information, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of his client.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This hearing may be streamed live at the discretion of the Court via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 5/14/22. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Alexis D Acosta in court with attorney Jason Daniel Baltz.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge  Kiefer, Branch 29.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 29.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have  NO VIOLENT CONTACT with JA (DOB 12/27/1985),LA (DOB 10/2/2006) and NA (DOB 2/14/2011)

Adjustment Number: 22A 043578,
Payable Number: 1004644,
Receipt Number: 22RP018217,
Amount: $20.00
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/12/2022@2:30pm
